protocol_name: RNA Isolation from Viral-infected Chlorella NC64A
protocol_name_html: RNA Isolation from Viral-infected Chlorella NC64A
guidelines:
Materials:

1.)     NC64A mid-log phase cells, 1-2 X 107 cells/ml

2.)     PBCV-1 or other virus

3.)     liquid nitrogen

4.)     spatulas, baked

5.)     2 ml microfuge tubes, sterile, RNAse-free (use gloves w/unopened bag, autoclave)

6.)     0.25-0.30 mm glass beads, 250 mg each sample, baked

7.)     chloroform (w/o isoamyl alcohol)

8.)     isopropanol (use a bottle exclusively for RNA work)

9.)     75 % EtOH (use EtOH set aside for RNA work only, dilute w/ DEPC-treated water)

10.)   10X MOPS buffer = 400 mM MOPS, 100 mM NaOAc, pH 7.0 (DEPC-treated)

                  10X MOPS:

                  92.48 g MOPS

                  13.61 g NaOAc×3H20

                  Adjust to pH 7.0 w/ NaOH

                  dd-H20 to 1 L

11.)   1 M MgCl2 solution (DEPC-treated)

12.)   DNAse I (RNAse-free)

13.)   dd-H20 (DEPC-treated)

14.)   1:1 phenol/chloroform (prepared w/o additives for RNA work exclusively)

 

Note: DEPC-treat solutions by addition of 0.1% diethylpyrocarbonate, dissolving DEPC by vigorous mixing, incubating 1 h at 37°C or overnight at 25°C, and autoclaving.  Caution: DEPC is toxic.

The RNA isolation procedure shown is a modification of the TRIZOL procedure, which is based on a procedure originally developed by Chomczynski and Sachi [Anal. Biochem. 162, 156-159 (1987)].

components.data: Grow NC64A to mid-log phase.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Grow NC64A to mid-log phase.

components.data: Concentrate to 1 x 10<sup>8</sup> cells/ml.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Concentrate to 1 x 10<sup>8</sup> cells/ml.

components.data: Use 30 ml concentrated cells per time point (3 x 10<sup>9</sup> cells~91 mg cells wet weight).
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Use 30 ml concentrated cells per time point (3 x 10<sup>9</sup> cells~91 mg cells wet weight).

components.data: Infect with virus at m.o.i.=5 for appropriate time.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Infect with virus at m.o.i.=5 for appropriate time.

components.data: Harvest infected cells by centrifugation at 5000 rpm, 5 min., 4°C.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Harvest infected cells by centrifugation at 5000 rpm, 5 min., 4°C.

components.data: Discard supernatant and flash freeze pellet in liquid nitrogen.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Discard supernatant and flash freeze pellet in liquid nitrogen.

components.data: Store at -80°C until ready to proceed to step #8.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Store at -80°C until ready to proceed to step #8.

components.data: Take 1 to 2 samples from the freezer at a time (keep on ice), break pellets loose with spatula,  and add 1 ml TRIZOL reagent to each tube.  Work as quickly as possible to prevent RNA degradation.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Take 1 to 2 samples from the freezer at a time (keep on ice), break pellets loose with spatula,  and add 1 ml TRIZOL reagent to each tube.  Work as quickly as possible to prevent RNA degradation.

components.data: Break pellets up with spatula and vortexing.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Break pellets up with spatula and vortexing.

components.data: Pipet into 2 ml microcentrifuge tube(s) containing 250 mg of 0.25-0.30 mm baked glass beads.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Pipet into 2 ml microcentrifuge tube(s) containing 250 mg of 0.25-0.30 mm baked glass beads.

components.data: Immediately vortex at highest speed 5 min., 4°C.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Immediately vortex at highest speed 5 min., 4°C.

components.data: Place at -80°C overnight.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Place at -80°C overnight.

components.data: Repeat steps #8-12 for the remaining samples.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Repeat steps #8-12 for the remaining samples.

source_data.thread_title: Annotation on step 13 of RNA Isolation from Viral-infected Chlorella NC64A
source_data.protocol_name: RNA Isolation from Viral-infected Chlorella NC64A
source_data.protocol_name_html: RNA Isolation from Viral-infected Chlorella NC64A
source_data.annotation: Note: samples may be stored at -80°C for up to 1 month at this point.
source_data.thread_text: Note: samples may be stored at -80°C for up to 1 month at this point.
source_data.body: Note: samples may be stored at -80°C for up to 1 month at this point.

components.data: Thaw samples and vortex another 5 minutes.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Thaw samples and vortex another 5 minutes.

components.data: Add 250 µl chloroform to samples, then vortex briefly.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Add 250 µl chloroform to samples, then vortex briefly.

components.data: Let stand at room temp. 3 min.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Let stand at room temp. 3 min.

components.data: Centrifuge samples at 12,000 x g, 15 min., 4°C.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Centrifuge samples at 12,000 x g, 15 min., 4°C.

components.data: Withdraw the RNA-containing aqueous upper phase and deliver to fresh microcentrifuge tube.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Withdraw the RNA-containing aqueous upper phase and deliver to fresh microcentrifuge tube.

components.data: Add 500 µl isopropanol.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Add 500 µl isopropanol.

components.data: Let stand 10 min. at room temp.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Let stand 10 min. at room temp.

components.data: Centrifuge at 12,000 x g, 10 min., 4°C.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Centrifuge at 12,000 x g, 10 min., 4°C.

components.data: Discard supernatant.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Discard supernatant.

components.data: Wash pellet with 75% EtOH with vortexing.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Wash pellet with 75% EtOH with vortexing.

source_data.thread_title: Annotation on step 23 of RNA Isolation from Viral-infected Chlorella NC64A
source_data.protocol_name: RNA Isolation from Viral-infected Chlorella NC64A
source_data.protocol_name_html: RNA Isolation from Viral-infected Chlorella NC64A
source_data.annotation: Note: samples may be stored for one year at -20°C in the 75% EtOH wash at this point.
source_data.thread_text: Note: samples may be stored for one year at -20°C in the 75% EtOH wash at this point.
source_data.body: Note: samples may be stored for one year at -20°C in the 75% EtOH wash at this point.

components.data: Centrifuge 12,000 x g, 5 min., 4°C.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Centrifuge 12,000 x g, 5 min., 4°C.

components.data: Dry pellets in vacuum dessicator 5-10 min.  DO NOT DRY COMPLETELY.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Dry pellets in vacuum dessicator 5-10 min.  DO NOT DRY COMPLETELY.

components.data: DNAse each sample by resuspending each pellet in 250 µl dd-H20.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: DNAse each sample by resuspending each pellet in 250 µl dd-H20.

source_data.thread_title: Annotation on step 26 of RNA Isolation from Viral-infected Chlorella NC64A
source_data.protocol_name: RNA Isolation from Viral-infected Chlorella NC64A
source_data.protocol_name_html: RNA Isolation from Viral-infected Chlorella NC64A
source_data.annotation: Note: Adding part of the dd-H<sub>2</sub>0 alone first to pellet. This seems to make the pellet go into solution faster.
source_data.thread_text: Note: Adding part of the dd-H<sub>2</sub>0 alone first to pellet. This seems to make the pellet go into solution faster.
source_data.body: Note: Adding part of the dd-H<sub>2</sub>0 alone first to pellet. This seems to make the pellet go into solution faster.

components.data: Add 250 µl of 2X MOPS, 20mM MgCl<sub>2</sub> (2X), and 100-200 U RNAse-free DNAse I.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Add 250 µl of 2X MOPS, 20mM MgCl<sub>2</sub> (2X), and 100-200 U RNAse-free DNAse I.

components.data: Incubate 1-2 h on ice.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Incubate 1-2 h on ice.

components.data: Extract with equal volume of phenol:chloroform (500 µl).
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Extract with equal volume of phenol:chloroform (500 µl).

components.data: Centrifuge at 12,000 x g, 5 min., 4°C.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Centrifuge at 12,000 x g, 5 min., 4°C.

components.data: Withdraw aqueous phase, add NaOAc to 0.3 M.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Withdraw aqueous phase, add NaOAc to 0.3 M.

components.data: Add 1 ml isopropanol.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Add 1 ml isopropanol.

components.data: Let stand 10 min., room temp.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Let stand 10 min., room temp.

components.data: Centrifuge up to 12,000 x g, 10 min., 4°C.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Centrifuge up to 12,000 x g, 10 min., 4°C.

components.data: Discard supernatant.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Discard supernatant.

components.data: Wash pellet with 75 % EtOH with vortexing.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Wash pellet with 75 % EtOH with vortexing.

components.data: Centrifuge 12,000 x g, 5 min., 4°C.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Centrifuge 12,000 x g, 5 min., 4°C.

components.data: Dry pellets in vacuum dessicator 5-10 min.  Do not dry completely.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Dry pellets in vacuum dessicator 5-10 min.  Do not dry completely.

components.data: Resuspend pellets in 40-50 µl water.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Resuspend pellets in 40-50 µl water.

source_data.annotation: Freezing at -80°C and then thawing seems to help the RNA go into solution better.
source_data.thread_text: Freezing at -80°C and then thawing seems to help the RNA go into solution better.
source_data.body: Freezing at -80°C and then thawing seems to help the RNA go into solution better.
